verses.verse: And Job<WH347> again<WH3254> took<WH5375> up his discourse<WH4912> and said,<WH559>
"Oh<WH4310> <WH5414> that I were as in months<WH3391> gone<WH6924> by, As in the days<WH3117> when God<WH433> watched<WH8104> over me;
When His lamp<WH5216> shone<WH9096> over<WH5921> my head,<WH7218> [And] by His light<WH216> I walked<WH1980> through darkness;<WH2822>
As I was in the prime<WH2779> of my days,<WH3117> When the friendship<WH5475> of God<WH433> [was] over<WH5921> my tent;<WH168>
When the Almighty<WH7706> was yet<WH5750> with me, [And] my children<WH5288> were around<WH5439> me;
When my steps<WH1978> were bathed<WH7364> in butter,<WH2529> And the rock<WH6697> poured<WH6694> out for me streams<WH6388> of oil!<WH8081>
"When I went<WH3318> out to the gate<WH8179> of the city,<WH7176> When I took<WH3559> my seat<WH4186> in the square;<WH7339>
The young<WH5288> men<WH5288> saw<WH7200> me and hid<WH2244> themselves, And the old<WH3453> men<WH3453> arose<WH6965> [and] stood.<WH5975>
"The princes<WH8269> stopped<WH6113> talking,<WH4405> And put<WH7760> [their] hands<WH3709> on their mouths;<WH6310>
The voice<WH6963> of the nobles<WH5057> was hushed,<WH2244> And their tongue<WH3956> stuck<WH1692> to their palate.<WH2441>
"For when the ear<WH241> heard,<WH8085> it called<WH833> me blessed;<WH833> And when the eye<WH5869> saw,<WH7200> it gave<WH5749> witness<WH5749> of me,
Because<WH3588> I delivered<WH4422> the poor<WH6041> who cried<WH7768> for help,<WH7768> And the orphan<WH3490> who had no<WH3808> helper.<WH5826>
"The blessing<WH1293> of the one ready to perish came<WH6> upon me, And I made the widow's heart<WH935> sing<WH3820> for joy.<WH7442>
"I put<WH3847> on righteousness,<WH6664> and it clothed<WH3847> me; My justice<WH4941> was like a robe<WH4598> and a turban.<WH6797>
"I was eyes<WH5869> to the blind,<WH5787> And feet<WH7272> to the lame.<WH6455>
"I was a father to the needy,<WH1> And I investigated<WH34> the case<WH2713> which I did not know.<WH7379>
"And I broke<WH7665> the jaws<WH4973> of the wicked,<WH5767> And snatched<WH7993> the prey<WH2964> from his teeth.<WH8127>
"Then I thought,<WH559> 'I shall die<WH1478> in my nest,<WH7064> And I shall multiply<WH7235> [my] days<WH3117> as the sand.<WH2344>
'My root<WH8328> is spread<WH6605> out to the waters,<WH4325> And dew<WH2919> lies<WH3885> all night<WH3885> on my branch.<WH9524>
'My glory<WH9202> is [ever] new<WH2319> with me, And my bow<WH7198> is renewed<WH2498> in my hand.<WH3027>'
"To me they listened<WH8085> and waited,<WH3176> And kept<WH1826> silent<WH1826> for my counsel.<WH6098>
"After<WH310> my words<WH1697> they did not speak<WH8138> again,<WH8138> And my speech<WH4405> dropped<WH5197> on them.
"And they waited<WH3176> for me as for the rain,<WH4306> And opened<WH6473> their mouth<WH6310> as for the spring<WH4456> rain.<WH4456>
"I smiled<WH7832> on them when they did not believe,<WH539> And the light<WH216> of my face<WH6440> they did not cast<WH5307> down.<WH5307>
"I chose<WH977> a way<WH1870> for them and sat<WH3427> as chief,<WH7218> And dwelt<WH7931> as a king<WH4428> among the troops,<WH1416> As one who<WH9201> comforted<WH5162> the mourners.<WH57>
